meanings.definition: To have complete control or understanding of something.
meanings.sent1: After many hours of practice, she finally mastered the piano piece.
meanings.sent2: He has mastered the art of cooking delicious meals.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it had mastered the art of hiding, but its tail always gave it away.
meanings.sent4: She had mastered the puzzle of life, fitting all the pieces together perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The magician had truly mastered the trick, leaving the audience in awe.

meanings.definition: To have become highly skilled or proficient in something.
meanings.sent1: The young gymnast mastered the balance beam routine with ease.
meanings.sent2: He mastered the skill of juggling multiple tasks at once.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel had mastered the art of stealing birdseed from the feeder.
meanings.sent4: She had mastered the dance moves, gliding across the floor effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The artist had truly mastered the brush strokes, creating a masterpiece on canvas.
